article.title: Inlines
article.subtitle: An docbook2odf example

abstract.para: One of the more common elements of writing are inline documents This article shows how the various inlines render.

article.para: This article shows various examples of inline elements.

section.para: The most common quote be a quoted string and a quoted inner string. A more excessive quote would have four nested quotes: such as this and this right?
While the basic emphasis is typically rendered as italics, the role attribute can change the type of emphasis. For example: strong, bold, strikethrough, underline.
Another useful formatting is superscripts (such as x2) and subscripts (such as H2O). These typically don't show as much in novel or story writing, but they do in other common uses of DocBook.
